page.title: 10Darenth Woods, A Resource
page.content: Both our Primary schools use Darenth Woods as an educational resource. We go to Darenth Woods about once a month with our class. We saw some men coppicing the trees. If they didn't do this the trees would get too heavy and the trunks would split. One man saws with a chain saw while the other man pushes with a stick. They put the wood into piles then a tractor comes and takes it to the paper mills. The main type of tree to be coppiced is the hornbeam. Because coppicing lets a lot of light reach the woodland floor the wood has many kinds of wild flowers including types of orchids. Blue Circle own the mineral rights of the woods and we are afraid that one day they will dig up the woods to quarry the chalk underneath. Our school has adopted part of the woods to help protect them.
